alert.note: Alert for Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 17 at 2:09AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST FOR NORTHEASTERN OCEAN AND MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 209 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Allenwood, or near Asbury Park, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Lakewood, Middletown, Howell, Marlboro, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Matawan, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Farmingdale, Mantoloking, Allenwood, East Freehold, Adelphia and Elberon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 25 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 90 and 120. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
